critique: The document establishes Federal Prison Industries, Inc., giving it broad powers to manage industrial operations within US penal institutions. It prioritizes diversifying prison industries to avoid undue burden on any single private industry, directs the transfer of funds and assets to the corporation, and mandates cooperation from other government entities. The order does not explicitly address ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, or social inclusion, so the initial scores are set to neutral. The revised scores reflect a slight increase in economic regulation due to the creation of a government entity to manage prison industries and a slight increase in federal control due to the centralization of prison industry management at the federal level.
